intro: Macrolearia × traillii, commonly known as the hybrid macrolearia, is a rare and unique plant resulting from the cross between two species of the genus Macrolearia. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically display a mix of purple, pink, and white hues. The plant is native to New Zealand and thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and slightly hairy. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Macrolearia × traillii is considered a conservation concern.
